text: Amazon quick site natively connects to
data in s3 allowing you to quickly and
easily visualize data without using
relational database before quick site
can read data from an s3 bucket we have
to ensure that it has the right
permissions to do so let's navigate to
the account permissions section in quick
site which is accessible to all
AWS administrators
we see that Amazon quick site has access
to both buckets in this case so let's go
ahead and set up a new s3 datasource as
three connections require a manifest
file which is a simple JSON format file
that contains links to the files you
would like to upload to spice once you
upload the file quick site lets you
quickly ingest this into spice and get
started with your analysis
